report_title: Audio Production Studios in the US
executive_summary: The Audio Production Studios industry has experienced volatile conditions. Online streaming services have sparked a structural change in how media is consumed, distributed and recorded. Alongside new distribution mediums, recent technological improvements in recording equipment have enabled musicians and artists to take more control over their content than ever before.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: As health and safety concerns eased, the industry capitalized on pent-up demand. The ability to collaborate remotely has become increasingly important in the wake of the COVID-19 pandemic. Audio production studios equipped with remote collaboration tools and workflows can work with clients and collaborators from anywhere worldwide, expanding their reach and attracting clients who value flexibility and convenience.

While demand for industry services expanded due to the growth of the entertainment industry, digital platforms and the emergence of remote collaboration, audio production studios have also encountered increased competition due to technological advances in the recording space.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Diverse Downstream Industries Provide Constant Demand
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The diversity of the industry's clientele (movies, TV shows, commercials and audiobooks) all require postproduction editing and mastering, which controls volatility and ensures that demand will not diminish rapidly over time. Since the expertise provided by audio production studios is not easily replicated, these other markets have continued to seek the industry's services.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: TECHNOLOGICAL ADVANCEMENTS ARE REDEFINING THE MUSIC INDUSTRY
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The music industry has been experiencing a shift in its business model. The internet has forced record labels to move away from physical album sales and online sales of digital singles in favor of on-demand, subscription-based streaming music consumption.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: ENTERTAINING CONSUMERS THROUGH NEW PLATFORMS WILL PROVE BENEFICIAL
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The Audio production studios industry benefits from various revenue streams, including TV, movie, radio and advertising. Secondary revenue streams will experience steady growth as the film and TV markets continue to blossom and the streaming boom continues.

The increasing availability of high-quality and affordable recording equipment makes it easier for both independent and established artists to acquire the technology used by audio production studios. Still, it does not replace the services experienced audio production engineers and technicians can provide, as this is not an asset that can be purchased in the market.

There's a growing demand for immersive audio formats such as Dolby Atmos and Ambisonics. Studios are investing in technologies and expertise to offer services for mixing and mastering immersive audio content for music, film, gaming and virtual reality applications.

industry_definition: Companies in this industry provide facilities and technical expertise for sound recording in a studio. Companies provide audio production or postproduction services for producing master recordings and may provide audio services for film, TV and video productions. After the recording has taken place, studios often perform postproduction services to adjust and master music recordings.

market_segmentation.segment_description: TV and film producers use sound recording studios throughout the different stages of production, though most work for the TV and film producers comes during the final stages of postproduction.

The music industry, which encompasses recording artists, independent label music production companies and major label music production companies, comprises a substantial portion of the industry's revenue. The expertise in professional audio production studios will continue to serve the needs of major and independent record labels, ensuring this segment's continued relevance.
Private companies working alongside a contracted advertising agency or through an in-house marketing team often consult audio production studios to fulfill various audio editing needs.

Spoken word clients include all producers of oral projects, which consist of audiobooks and spoken manuscripts. Audio production studios also provide recording and production services for creators of comedy albums, poetry and educational materials.

Current radio programming clients often require the industry's studios to create various effects, sweepers and other spots. The radio market has declined as listeners increasingly turn toward music streaming. However, many individuals still turn to the radio to keep them company during their commutes, sustaining demand for audio production services.

Other services include commercial audio and TV audio mastering. Some studios also offer classes in production techniques and equipment. This is becoming increasingly popular as content mediums like YouTube enable studios to distribute lessons via the internet and more individuals look to produce their own recordings.

products_and_services.product_description: Postproduction services primarily involve mastering and mixing audio content. This process fine-tunes audio recordings to ensure the highest quality product.

This segment will likely strengthen its revenue share as more independent artists record their content. While the accessibility of audio equipment and software will circumvent studios, many independent artists will still turn to industry services for post-production processes.
Other activities include licensing rights to use recorded demos and outtakes, support services, audio transfer services, audio copying and income from session booking fees.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Advertising companies use various services and facilities offered by sound recording studios, including commercial spot production, audio postproduction and duplication services. Increasing advertising expenditures positively influences the industry since more downstream markets demand audio production services to enhance audio quality, boosting studio revenue.

A hike in disposable income leads to an expansion in consumer demand for various entertainment services, including TV, movies and music. As disposable income rises, people will spend more to enhance their products. These entertainment industries all use audio production studios to create projects. Growth in per capita disposable income represents a potential opportunity for the industry.

The level of federal funding for creative arts benefits audio production studios, which may require grants to support various archival and remastering projects. However, as the federal deficit has ballooned recently, Congress has reduced the National Endowment for the Arts (NEA) funding. Cuts in federal funding for the creative arts pose a potential threat to the industry.

business_locations.location_description: The high proportion of establishments in the West region is primarily due to concentrations in the music, film, and TV industries, which require sound production and postproduction services.
This region serves as a hub for this profession thanks to the intense music and film industries in places like Atlanta and Nashville.
More than half of the Mid-Atlantic production studios are in New York. The presence of multiple downstream markets, such as movie and TV production, attracts studios.

regulations_points.regulation_title: THE AUDIO HOME RECORDING ACT OF 1992
regulations_points.regulation_description: This act was introduced in response to the increasing number of digital music recording formats that had emerged in the 20th century. Popular new media formats enabled consumers to duplicate music from a source without any degradation in quality.

regulations_points.regulation_title: THE DIGITAL PERFORMANCE RIGHTS IN SOUND RECORDINGS ACT OF 1995
regulations_points.regulation_description: The introduction of digital technology created a legal gray area that did not specify copyrights for sound recordings performed publicly through digital transmission. This law permits copyright owners of sound recordings to authorize certain digital information of their works.

This regulation was a significant legal overhaul of how the United States classified and criminalized illegal production and dissemination of many technologies and services that controlled access to copyrighted works.

The No Electronic Theft Act establishes maximum penalties and fines for individuals found to have infringed upon the copyrights of specific works. This law permits individuals of sound recording infringements to be criminally prosecuted even where no monetary profit or commercial gain is derived from the activity.

regulations_points.regulation_title: TRADE-RELATED ASPECTS OF INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY RIGHTS (THE TRIPS AGREEMENT)
regulations_points.regulation_description: The leading international law that affects this industry is the Trade-Related Aspects of Intellectual Property Rights Agreement. This law states that performers have the right to prevent fixation (i.e., to capture in some tangible form like film or sound recording) of their unfixed performances, the reproduction of that fixation and the wireless broadcasting of their live performances when done without their authorization.

In 2020, social distancing protocols enforced by federal, state and local government regulations led to reduced levels of consumer spending, increased time spent at home by individuals and a sharp reduction in public congregations and gatherings. This led to many audio production studios having to operate at a reduced capacity or shut down altogether.

barriers_points.barrier_title: Legal barriers exist due to copyright and intellectual property laws and regulations
barriers_points.barrier_description: One must thoroughly understand the legal landscape because these regulations can be complex and challenging.

barriers_points.barrier_title: Networking and industry contacts crucial for gaining contracts
barriers_points.barrier_description: Fully equipped studios may offer homogeneous services and similar prices, so personal contacts can often be a deciding factor in entering the industry.

barriers_points.barrier_title: High cost of equipment and initial capital outlay
barriers_points.barrier_description: Potential new entrants must consider the high cost of equipment and the initial outlay on capital equipment.

barriers_points.barrier_title: Requires high skill and experience for high-quality audio production
barriers_points.barrier_description: The production of high-quality audio content requires significant time and effort. Because producing high-quality audio content requires a high level of skill and experience, this can make it difficult for new players to get started.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Low barriers to entry welcome new competitors
concentration_points.concentration_description: The industry has low entry barriers, making it easier for new players to start and make a name for themselves.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Shift from large studios to private home studios
concentration_points.concentration_description: Historically, the industry has been composed primarily of small companies, but there has been a shift from large studios to private home studios. Artists act as sole proprietors who engage in industry activities while producing their material.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Wide range of downstream markets attracts niche markets
concentration_points.concentration_description: The industry's diversity and fragmentation, with studios catering to various niches and markets, is also reflected in the industry's low concentration of market share.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Fragmentation allows differentiation and niche segments
concentration_points.concentration_description: Studios can use this fragmentation to differentiate themselves and establish a distinct market segment.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Studios of all sizes benefit from various services and pricing models
concentration_points.concentration_description: Studios of all sizes can benefit from various services and pricing models.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: WAGES ACCOUNT FOR THE MOST SIGNIFICANT EXPENSE FOR THE AUDIO PRODUCTION STUDIOS INDUSTRY
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: The nature of the industry requires trained sound technicians and engineers that work closely with recording artists to produce quality sound recordings.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: LOW OPERATING COSTS ATTRACT NEW STUDIOS AND RAISE PRICE COMPETITION
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Industry profit is representative of the relatively low operating costs associated with running a recording studio. Still, price competition has led profitability to contract in recent years.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: SECURING A STUDIO IN THE RIGHT PLACE IS COSTLY
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: The average audio production studio will spend nearly 10.0% of revenue on rent costs. Costly rents often result from high-profile locations where establishments must lease quality studio space.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The production of high-quality audio content requires significant time and effort. Because producing high-quality audio content requires a high level of skill and experience, this can make it difficult for new players to get started.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Increasingly accessible professional-grade recording technology to the public has constrained industry growth to an extent. Since many individual musicians can construct makeshift recording studios that serve the basic needs of record production, renting production studio space can often be avoided.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Traditional Production Companies Will Likely Help Stabilize Revenue
volatility_points.volatility_description: Industry volatility is insulated by the diverse markets the audio production studios serve. The breadth and scope of markets varying from the entertainment industry to advertising enable audio production studios to partly shield themselves from any volatile loss in demand from one particular client.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: VIRTUAL RECORDING STUDIOS PROVIDE COMFORT AND EFFICIENCY
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Virtual recording studios are quickly becoming popular in the audio production industry because of their increased adaptability and ease of use for artists and producers alike.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE-POWERED AUDIO PRODUCTION ADDS A NEW DIMENSION
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: AI is being incorporated into audio production to improve sound quality and streamline production procedures. AI-powered tools are being used to automate tasks like mixing, mastering and sound design, which helps save time and effort.

FAQs.question: How have changes in individual consumer electronic use affected your company's operations?
FAQs.answer: Streaming services have made music more popular than ever, necessitating more audio production studios.

FAQs.question: How have changes in technology affected the costs associated with serving your company's customers?
FAQs.answer: New technology allows for some artists to produce their music in their homes, which affects demand for production studios.

FAQs.question: How has a shift towards conducting business online affected demand for your company's services?
FAQs.answer: As more music has been consumed than ever before due to streaming services, the need for audio production studios has increased.

FAQs.question: Is your company strategically located in a region that acts to its benefit?
FAQs.answer: Owners of production studios tend to open locations geographically in line with where their musical expertise is prevalent.

FAQs.question: Has your company been able to keep current with changing digital interfaces?
FAQs.answer: Audio production studios with the most up-to-date technology can effectively market to musicians, making it of the utmost importance for studios.

FAQs.question: How have software advances altered your company's operations?
FAQs.answer: Technology advances have allowed for more digital production of music recorded in production studios.

FAQs.question: Does your company work with trade associations or other interest groups to advance its interests?
FAQs.answer: There are some trade associations that work with music studios.

FAQs.question: How have recent regulatory changes affected your company's operations?
FAQs.answer: There is very little regulation of production studios in general.

FAQs.question: Has technological change had a positive effect on your company's financial performance?
FAQs.answer: Technology has made it easier for audio production studios to make music, as well as for newer artists to produce their music at home.

FAQs.question: How did your company's profit compare to its main competitors in the past year?
FAQs.answer: Production studios profit varies based on the number of clients they work with and the level of popularity of the musicians. Nonetheless, stiff price competition due to poor macroeconomic conditions limiting clientele caused average margins to fall.

FAQs.question: How does your company retain its most reputable producers? How often does it renegotiate contracts?
FAQs.answer: Having a highly skilled and creative production team with a strong reputation among clients is essential to companies in this industry.

FAQs.question: What are your company's outreach strategies for attracting new artists? What competitive advantages can it offer potential clients?
FAQs.answer: Successful companies maintain contracts directly with talented artists and record companies.

FAQs.question: How often does your company update its studio technology? Are its systems a selling point for potential clients?
FAQs.answer: Access to the latest recording technology, editing tools and soundproofed studio space are critical for industry operators to capture sound of the highest quality.

FAQs.question: As album sales fall, what other audio production markets can your company pivot to? How can your business establish relationships in new fields?
FAQs.answer: The largest market for this industry is the music industry. Therefore, increased US album sales boost demand for industry services.

FAQs.question: How much of your company's revenue comes from advertising clients? Can your company expand its work in this arena?
FAQs.answer: Advertising companies use various services and facilities offered by sound recording studios, including commercial spot production, audio postproduction and duplication services. However, revenue from this segment was extremely limited in 2020 as total ad revenue fell in response to dwindling corporate profit.

FAQs.question: How has increased consumer demand for media during the pandemic affected your company's revenue? Can your business renegotiate contracts in light of this?
FAQs.answer: An increase in disposable income leads to an increase in consumer demand for a range of entertainment services including TV, movies and music. These entertainment industries all use audio production studios to create projects.
